content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Setup at (-14, 23)
- Burner mining drill at (-14, 23) mining coal
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) storing iron ore (180 units)

### Coal Mining Setup at (24, -15)
- Burner mining drill at (24, -15) mining coal
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) storing coal (227 units)

### Copper Ore Mining and Processing at (20, 20)
Consists of two mining and processing lines:
1. First line:
- Burner mining drill at (20, 20)
- Wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5) storing copper ore (230 units)

2. Second line:
- Wooden chest at (22.5, 21.5) storing copper ore (397 units)
- Burner inserter at (22.5, 20.5) moving ore from chest to furnace
- Stone furnace at (24, 20)
- Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving processed plates
- Wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) storing copper plates (53 units)

### Iron Processing Setup at (-11, 20)
- Two stone furnaces at (-11, 20) and (-9, 20)

ERROR TIPS

### Furnace Fuel Management Issues
- Monitor furnace fuel levels before attempting to insert more fuel
- Check if furnace fuel inventory is full (50/50) before attempting to add more coal

### Inserter Fuel Issues
- Ensure inserters have fuel (coal) to operate
- The copper ore furnace input inserter at (22.5, 20.5) has run out of fuel and needs refueling

### Process Flow Issues
- Furnaces showing NO_INGREDIENTS status need proper input setup
- Verify inserter pickup and drop positions align with input/output requirements
- Ensure the complete production chain (mining -> storage -> furnace -> storage) has proper connections and fuel

### Resource Management
- Monitor resource chest levels to prevent overflow
- Ensure proper distribution of resources between multiple processing lines
